title: Public transport for the A-League Round 16 - Melbourne Victory v Sydney FC: Friday 24 January 2025
articleContent:
The A-League Men’s season continues at AAMI Park. Public transport is your best way to enjoy it, as Melbourne Victory take on Sydney FC.

The event will begin at 7.35pm.

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey planner and check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

 Metropolitan train

Please note the following occupations:

  • Replacement buses running between North Melbourne station and Sunshine
  • Pakenham / Cranbourne train lines will terminate at Caulfield

Return service from Richmond Station:

  • Ringwood leaving 9:56pm from Platform 9
  • Glen Waverley – leaving at 10:00pm from Platform 10
  • Dandenong – leaving at 9:46pm from Platform 6
  • Frankston leaving at 9:51pm from Platform 4
  • Sandringham – leaving at 9:54pm from Platform 2

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from AAMI Park

Route 70

  • Trams will operate from Flinders Street / Elizabeth Street (Stop 4) and Stop 7C MCG/John Cain Arena.  

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

 Metropolitan bus

Passengers can catch the following buses close to AAMI Park:

  • Route 246

Please note, services may terminate prior to the end of the match.

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

 Regional train

Normal services departing to and from Southern Cross Station.

Plan your journey using Journey planner.
